content.text: Pascia is a female dancer, who was to be sold at the Auction House.

Pascia is a young woman with long purple hair and dark brown eyes. She wears a long white dress with some pink details on it, and a yellow headpiece with a red gem piece at the front. In the manga, there is no red gem.

Pascia seemed to be a quiet and saddened woman when she was up for auction. After receiving the keys to her chains, however, she, as well as the rest of the slaves, seemed happy and excited about their freedom.
At some point in her life, she was captured and taken to the Auction House.
When Disco brought Pascia to the auction stage, Sanji asked Nami if they could buy her as well (during their attempt to buy Camie's freedom), annoying Nami and Chopper and provoking them to hit him.
Pascia is seen again when Franky throws the keys to the other slaves in the Auction House, shortly after Rayleigh got things under control. She presumably escaped successfully.

images.caption: Pascia and the other slaves celebrate their freedom.

content.text: Pascia's appearance is slightly altered in the anime. Her top originally had a tattoo-like design on the sleeves, which was removed. Also, a red gem was added to her headpiece.

In the anime, when Pascia was placed onto auction, Sanji expressed anger that the sellers would be so cruel to a beautiful girl, as opposed to the manga, where he simply asked Nami to buy her as well.

elements.text: Pascia's starting bid was 800,000, though she was sold for 7,200,000.
She was #15 on the auction list, rated as the world's most beautiful slave girl, and was described as a 20-year-old female dancer of excellent proportions.
↑  One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 51 Chapter 501 and Episode 395, Pascia the dancer is introduced and placed on auction.
↑  Vivre Card - One Piece Visual Dictionary, Pascia's birthday is given.
↑  One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 52 Chapter 504 and Episode 398, Pascia and the other slaves are freed.
↑  One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 51 Chapter 502 and Episode 396, Pascia is sold off.
